trial_identification.studytitle: An Optimised Exercise Program for LapBand patients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of an optimised exercise program on weight loss in LapBand patients

interventions.interventions: Optimised exercise program (personal training 3 times a week) in bariatric patients (patients who have recieved the LapBand). The optimised program consists of 45 minute sessions with a qualified trainer incorporating a variety of aerobic and strength building exercises inclduing running, cycling, resistance training etc. The overall exercise progrma goes for 12 weeks in total.
interventions.comparator: control group; non exercising surgical patients. The duration of non-exercise in this group is 12 weeks. This group of bariatric patients also recieves the LapBand. However they do not participate in the exercise program. The patients are not given advice regarding exercise (they are neither encouraged or discouraged) and attend their normal number of clinical visits in accordance with standard care.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: baseline and then every two weeks for four months following randomisation

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. obese (BMI>30) 2. aged 18-60 3. not limited by mobility
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. prior stomach surgery (prior to this Lapband procedure)
